source_text: The Department of Justice provides for interested citizens access to nearly the entire body of current federal law at no cost via the Internet.
This research analyzes the political framing evident in congressional debates surrounding the introduction of the so-called healthcare copayment.
Pursuant to Section 12, Subsection 3 of the Administrative Procedures Act, the applicant is obligated to submit all required documentation.
The use of the database is free of charge, however commercial use of the documents requires prior consent from the Department.
The conflictual dimension of political framing has heretofore received insufficient scholarly attention in the existing literature.
